content:
As an AI language model, I can offer some general recommendations, but please note that the specific online courses or programs required for industrial skills may vary depending on the industry and the job position. Here are some general online courses and programs that can enhance your industrial skills:

1. Udemy - Udemy offers a range of online courses in industrial skills, including industrial automation, PLC programming, and industrial maintenance. 2. Coursera - Coursera offers many courses in the fields of engineering and manufacturing, including supply chain management, CAD design, and manufacturing processes. 3. MIT OpenCourseWare - MIT OpenCourseWare provides free online courses in various topics related to engineering, including supply chain management fundamentals, materials science, and manufacturing processes. 4. Alison - Alison provides online courses in industrial topics such as industrial automation, electrical systems, manufacturing processes, and welding. 5. OSHA - The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) has a range of free online courses and training materials in topics such as occupational health and safety, electrical hazards, and machine guarding. These are just a few examples of the many online courses and programs available for industrial skills. It's important to do your research and choose courses or programs that align with your career goals and the specific skills required for your target job positions.
